result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert G Prado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(3rd+ w/in3Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:10 p.m.  Defendant appears in court.
Defendant has the money to pay in full today.
Court authorizes warrant - stayed for payment in full today.
Court adjourned 1:10 p.m.

Original warrant has been received and destroyed.
43

ADDRESS INFO for Albert G Prado
Current: 1420 W Orchard Ave, c/o Anna Prado, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 11-17-2015)
Prior: 2471 S 10th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Request to cancel warrant with Sue S at GLSO today's date 9:15 a.m.-sr

8:59 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to count 1, will recommend jail and fine and costs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters  a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-10 days county jail with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Out of county service.
-$400 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:05 a.m.

Defendant called in regards to the warrant that was issued.  Defendant to appear in court on November 17, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Defendant was informed that the warrant would remain outstanding until he appeared in court.  Copy of the complaint will be sent with the notice of hearing.  Address on file is correct.
43

Warrant sent down to GLSO on 11/10/2015,.
43
to the defendant - respond on or before October 19, 2015 or warrant will be issued.

9:23 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed for ten days.

Court adjourned at 9:23 a.m.
